metadata.description: Validates all performance-related mentions and compliance requirements for financial documents

categories.listed_securities: Rules for funds invested in listed securities

glossary.rolling_performance: Annualized rolling returns over consecutive periods
glossary.annualized_performance: Average annual return over a specified period
glossary.cumulative_performance: Total return over a specified period

rules.rule_text: A commercial document or external communication cannot begin with performance but must at minimum start with the fund presentation. Performance can never represent the central element of a commercial document
rules.rationale: Ensures balanced presentation and prevents misleading emphasis on returns
rules.consequences_of_violation: Document must be restructured before distribution

examples.compliant: Document starts with fund objective and strategy, then presents performance
examples.non_compliant: Document leads with '20% annual returns' headline

rules.rule_text: Performance figures must not appear disproportionately compared to other elements (font size identical to main text)
rules.rationale: Prevents visual emphasis that could mislead investors

rules.rule_text: When the presentation is intended for retail clients, only retail share class performances (for listed: CR, DR, CN, DN, GC) may be presented
rules.rationale: Ensures clients see performance relevant to their accessible share classes
rules.consequences_of_violation: Remove non-retail share class performance data

rules.rule_text: Performance must be presented over a minimum period of 10 years for annualized performance and 5 years for others
rules.rationale: Provides sufficient historical context for informed decision-making
rules.consequences_of_violation: Extend performance history or remove if unavailable

rules.rule_text: When the fund cannot display a 10-year history, performance must be presented since fund inception
rules.rationale: Ensures maximum available historical data is shown for newer funds
rules.consequences_of_violation: Adjust performance period to show since inception

rules.rule_text: Performance must be presented in the form of rolling annual, annualized and/or cumulative returns
rules.rationale: Standardizes performance presentation for comparability
rules.consequences_of_violation: Reformat performance data to compliant format

rules.rule_text: If the fund has less than 3 years of history, cumulative performance is not displayed (except YTD and MTD)
rules.rationale: Prevents misleading short-term cumulative figures

rules.section: 4.3 - Specific mentions relating to performance - Germany
rules.rule_text: For Germany: rolling annual performance must be accompanied by performance from fund inception to the first year of rolling performance
rules.rationale: German regulatory requirement for complete historical context

rules.section: 4.3 - Specific mentions relating to performance - Germany
rules.rule_text: For Germany: the first year of rolling performance presentation incorporates maximum subscription fees. Similarly, maximum redemption fees (acquired or not acquired by the fund) specified in the prospectus must be mentioned in the last year
rules.rationale: German requirement to show all-in costs including entry/exit fees
rules.consequences_of_violation: Adjust performance calculations to include fees

rules.rule_text: YTD performance may be mentioned strictly on condition that performance over 10 years, 5 years, 3 years, 1 year and/or since inception is displayed. It can never be presented alone
rules.rationale: Prevents cherry-picking short-term positive results
rules.consequences_of_violation: Remove YTD or add long-term performance context

rules.rule_text: Funds with less than one year of performance history cannot display performance under any circumstances
rules.rationale: Minimum track record required to provide meaningful performance data
rules.consequences_of_violation: Remove all performance data from materials

rules.rule_text: Display of NAV (reference NAV and latest NAV) through an evolution chart is authorized except in Germany (simple mention of first and last NAV in table form)
rules.rationale: Allows visual performance representation with country-specific restrictions
rules.consequences_of_violation: Convert chart to table format for Germany

rules.rule_text: Performance of less than one month cannot be displayed under any circumstances (except YTD)
rules.rationale: Prevents emphasis on very short-term volatility

rules.rule_text: Performance must be permanently and mandatorily compared to the fund's reference indicator if one exists
rules.rationale: Provides essential context for evaluating fund management

rules.rule_text: Performance may also be compared, for information purposes only (to be explicitly mentioned), to another benchmark (which must be consistent with the strategy's performance drivers and stable over time)
rules.rationale: Allows additional context with clear disclosure

rules.rule_text: Strategy performance may be presented gross of fees (excluding fixed and variable management fees, transaction commission) to be specified in the document
rules.rationale: Professional client option with required disclosure

rules.rule_text: If gross performance is presented for strategies, this must be mandatorily highlighted via a specific disclaimer
rules.rationale: Ensures professional clients understand performance is pre-fee

rules.rule_text: When there has been a change in reference indicator and/or investment orientation and/or risk-return profile of the fund, a comment must be inserted in a visible manner identifying the nature and date of the change(s)
rules.rationale: Transparency about material changes affecting comparability

rules.rule_text: It is possible to present performance from the date of change in reference indicator and/or investment orientation and/or AMF-approved risk-return profile provided this new period is strictly greater than 1 year. This provision does not apply to dedicated funds
rules.rationale: Allows fresh start after material changes with minimum track record
rules.consequences_of_violation: Show full history or wait until 1+ year post-change

rules.rule_text: Reference indicator performance is stated according to prospectus terms (dividends included for example for equity funds)
rules.rationale: Ensures benchmark consistency with prospectus specifications
rules.consequences_of_violation: Adjust benchmark calculation to match prospectus

rules.rule_text: In the case of a merger between 2 funds, it is possible to adopt the absorbed fund's history if and only if the following conditions are met: 1/ the absorbing fund is strictly created by the merger with the absorbed fund, 2/ the investment strategy, management objective, management team and cost structure are strictly identical
rules.rationale: Strict criteria for historical performance continuity
rules.consequences_of_violation: Remove merged fund history if criteria not met

rules.rule_text: Dated funds that specify in their prospectus they have active management cannot display YTM (yield to maturity) or YTW (yield to worst) for retail clients
rules.rationale: Active management makes maturity yields unreliable predictors

rules.rule_text: Dated funds that specify in their prospectus they have a buy and hold or buy and maintain strategy may display YTM (yield to maturity) and YTW (yield to worst)
rules.rationale: Passive strategy makes maturity yields reliable indicators

rules.rule_text: Performance evolution in the form of net IRR is only communicated for professional private equity funds during their life
rules.rationale: IRR during fund life is appropriate for professional PE investors

rules.rule_text: Prohibition on displaying retail fund performance as net IRR before fund maturity
rules.rationale: Protects retail investors from potentially misleading interim IRR figures

rules.rule_text: Prohibition on displaying institutional fund track record to retail clients
rules.rationale: Prevents misleading retail clients with institutional performance

rules.rule_text: Information must not be based on or refer to simulations of past performance
rules.rationale: Prevents confusion between actual and simulated historical returns

rules.rule_text: It must be based on reasonable assumptions founded on objective elements
rules.rationale: Ensures projections are grounded in reality

rules.rule_text: When information is based on gross performance, the effect of commissions, fees or other charges must be specified
rules.rationale: Full transparency on impact of costs on projected returns

rules.rule_text: Performance simulations must be based on realistic market assumptions
rules.rationale: Prevents overly optimistic or unrealistic projections

rules.rule_text: Volatility assumptions used in future performance simulation charts must be consistent with underlying assets, allocation and simulated investment duration
rules.rationale: Ensures volatility parameters reflect actual investment characteristics

rules.rule_text: Use of performance simulation for periods when no data was yet available is only authorized for a new share class of an existing UCITS or investment compartment based on the performance of another share class, provided that the proportion these two share classes represent in fund assets does not differ substantially
rules.rationale: Allows proxy performance for new share classes under strict conditions

rules.rule_text: Any simulation on an already existing share class is prohibited
rules.rationale: Prevents rewriting actual performance history

rules.rule_text: Performance recalculation must mandatorily account for differences in fixed fees, variable fees, currencies, etc.
rules.rationale: Ensures simulated performance accurately reflects fee differences

rules.rule_text: The disclaimer must be displayed directly below or beside the performance and in clearly legible characters
rules.rationale: Ensures investors see and can read critical warnings

rules.rule_text: When presenting realized performance, the following disclaimer must be mandatorily displayed: 'Past performance is not indicative of future performance and is not constant over time'
rules.rationale: Standard regulatory warning about performance

validation_criteria.required_text: Past performance is not indicative of future performance and is not constant over time

examples.required_disclaimer: Past performance is not indicative of future performance and is not constant over time

rules.rule_text: When presenting backtested performance (professional clients and only in France), the following disclaimer must be mandatorily displayed: 'The figures refer to simulations of past performance. These simulations are the result of estimates by OBAM SAS at a given time, based on parameters selected by Oddo BHF Asset Management, market conditions at that time and historical data which do not prejudge future results. Consequently, these simulations have only an indicative value and cannot constitute in any way a promise of return.'
rules.rationale: Critical disclosure about limitations of backtested data

examples.required_disclaimer: The figures refer to simulations of past performance. These simulations are the result of estimates by OBAM SAS at a given time, based on parameters selected by Oddo BHF Asset Management, market conditions at that time and historical data which do not prejudge future results. Consequently, these simulations have only an indicative value and cannot constitute in any way a promise of return.

rules.rule_text: In case of future performance simulation, results must be mandatorily accompanied by the following disclaimer: 'The simulation presented does not constitute a forecast of the future performance of your investments. It is only intended to illustrate the mechanisms of your investment over the investment period. The evolution of the value of your investment may differ from what is displayed, upwards or downwards'
rules.rationale: Warns investors about uncertainty of projections

examples.required_disclaimer: The simulation presented does not constitute a forecast of the future performance of your investments. It is only intended to illustrate the mechanisms of your investment over the investment period. The evolution of the value of your investment may differ from what is displayed, upwards or downwards

rules.rule_text: In case of displaying multiple scenarios (such as favorable, unfavorable and neutral), add: 'Gains and losses may exceed the amounts displayed, respectively, in the most favorable and most unfavorable scenarios. By proceeding, you acknowledge having read this warning, understood it and accept its content'
rules.rationale: Ensures understanding that actual results may exceed scenario bounds

examples.required_disclaimer: Gains and losses may exceed the amounts displayed, respectively, in the most favorable and most unfavorable scenarios. By proceeding, you acknowledge having read this warning, understood it and accept its content

rules.rule_text: In case of simulated past performance, add: 'The performance displayed does not represent the actual performance of share class X over a given period. It is derived from simulations calculated by the management company from the performance of share class Y of the same fund, adjusted for fixed management fees, variable management fees, currencies'
rules.rationale: Clear disclosure that performance is simulated, not actual

examples.required_disclaimer_template: The performance displayed does not represent the actual performance of share class [X] over a given period. It is derived from simulations calculated by the management company from the performance of share class [Y] of the same fund, adjusted for fixed management fees, variable management fees, currencies

Confirm share classes to be presented

Use consistent font sizes for all content
Always pair performance with official benchmark
Include required disclaimers adjacent to performance

regulatory_context.primary_regulation: AMF (Autorit des Marchs Financiers) marketing rules
regulatory_context.objective: Ensure fair, balanced, and non-misleading presentation of fund and strategy performance to investors
key_principles: Transparency: All performance data must be clearly sourced and dated
Context: Performance must not be isolated from appropriate comparisons and historical perspective
Balance: Performance cannot dominate document presentation
Accuracy: Fees, benchmarks, and calculations must reflect actual investor experience
Protection: Retail investors receive additional protections vs. professional clients

enforcement.pre_publication: Internal compliance review required before external distribution
enforcement.post_publication: Subject to AMF review and potential sanctions for violations
enforcement.documentation: Maintain records of compliance checks and approvals
